The game is good, DON'T BUY IT!

It's price is almost the same L4D2, so what?

L4D2 has everything L4D has plus the L4D2 Part. It has the L4D campaings, it has the same achievements, same characters, everything.

Plus Better graphics, more players, more mods and new patches (last update:2020).

The price is the same, they enter on sale at the same time for the same  %.

There is NO reason for buying L4D.

That said, it IS an AWESOME game, but it is included in the sequel.

I didn't play L42 yet, (But I will play it some time, later on.) and I like this game. By the way, L2D, so much better I heard, because it adds new content, and you get the L4D 1 campaign. Ok, lets stop talking about L4D2, and start talking about L4D 1. Left 4 Dead 1, is a co-op zombie shooter that involves lots of teamwork, and almost impossible to beat on you're own. The guns: M1911 pistol, Duel M1911 pistols, Submachine gun, Pump Shotgun, Auto Shotgun, Assault Rifle and Hunting Rifle.
The Pistols: pretty weak, and you'll not use then often, but have unlimited ammo.
The Shotguns: One of the most powerful guns in the game, you can kill a zombie with shot of this weapon up close.
Fast Shooting Bois: The Assault Rifle and the submachine gun are weaker than the shotguns up close, but hold a lot more ammo.(This gun is meant for people that like shooting there gun every were.)
Sniper Rifles: There is only one sniper rifle, witch is the hunting rifle,(btw you need to press mouse 3, or press you're scroll thing on you're mouse.) This gun is better at far range, and kinda good for close range but I'll still recommend you use a shotgun.
Shoving: You can shove zombies by pressing mouse 2, or right click that can knock out zombies for a couple of secs, and you having time to finish then off.
Grenades:(You're almost at the end of this review. :) ) There are two grenades, the pipe bomb, and the molotov, The pipe grenade leads the zombie were you throw it, and the molotov sets things on fire.


This game is good, but I think and a lot of people think, L4D2 is better, and I'am not saying that you souldn't play this game, but if you want more content for this game play L42.

Game is pretty old but still holds up to this day

Don't get me wrong, this game is really great but there really is no point in playing this in 2020 when LFD in it's full entirety is literally just in LFD2. Also, whenever I go back to LFD1 I always find it kinda've weird that there isn't any melee weapons, I just feel like that is such a staple of LFD combat and really makes it feel like it went the extra mile. But I will say, I do like LFD1's darker atmosphere/tone and I like most of the characters more. But hey, you can play all of this in LFD2 with melee weapons added in as well as tons of brand new LFD2-exclusive campaigns, so there isn't much of a point.

Even between all the zombie games out there today it's still one of the most fun multiplayer zombie experiences I had.
Slow walker lovers be warned: these zombies can run and they can run fast!

Absolutely amazing game, I held thousands of hours of this game on console, very much worth for the price.

Deadly fun!  I recently purchased this game on a friend's recommendation.  The action is well-paced and not excessively jerky, weapons and explosives are varied and fun, enemies are realistic considering it is an old release, and the game gives an overall feeling of suspense appropriate to the genre.  One thing that would have made this game more enjoyable is if it had a city map which would track where I've been.
